items.title: Fix password match error, fix google button copy
items.body:
### Description
Recent signup flow staging release had two problems:
1. The sign up with Google button said Clever on it ü§¶ 
2. The form would actually still let you submit it even if passwords didn't match....all bark no bite

This PR fixes these

### Tickets
n/a

### Test Cases
1. run against staging
2. try to sign up for a teacher account with passwords that don't match
3. [verify] ya blocked
4. go to student side, use class code FUHRN7
5. try to sign up for student account with passwords that don't match
6. [verify] ya blocked

might as well make sure it WILL let you through with matching passwords as well

items.title: Feature/kick 702/sign up flow updates
items.body:
### Description
Updates to login -- changes look and data collection.

Figmas (they're both a little different) [here](https://www.figma.com/file/hP0F5lVygP6GnUw0FRFi5S/Sign-Up-Flow-Copy-Updates?type=whiteboard&node-id=0%3A1&t=yYdPe2qGsGy0JoIs-1) and [here](https://www.figma.com/file/IIBoLSHrXFJIa6rqGngu8S/trials_onboarding?type=design&node-id=5659%3A36546&mode=design&t=K1jghgRob5DfeiVb-1&fuid=1030509902211616563).

### Tickets

[702](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-702)

### Test Cases

‚ö†Ô∏è The student login flow looks different, and although this was not in the Figma, I okay'd with product that the login flow look updates spilled over onto student signup. ‚ö†Ô∏è 
**Student flow:**
1. Click sign up
2. I Am a Student
3. add a pro class code (FUHRN7)
4. sign up with username/email
5. fill out form items, click sign up
6. fill out firsty/lasty, click get started
7. log out, go back through and test with Google OAuth

**Teacher flow:**
1. Click sign up
2. I Am a Teacher
3. Sign up with email
4. Fill the stuff out (first and last name are not required in the figma but they are required in my form because the User Profile will throw a fit if it doesn't have a first/last name)
5. test out some of the error messages if you want
6. click sign up
7. fill out the second screen (my students call me, school name, grades/ages)
8. click get started
9. head to the User Profile section to make sure your choices for grade/subject/school were saved properly

items.title: Default tts to off
items.body:
### Description
So as to not annoy teachers & to keep parity w/iOS

### Tickets

[758](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-758)

### Test Cases

1. open in incognito window to make sure you have a fresh speech synthesis instance
2. log into anybody -- teacher, student
3. open assignment with text boxes
4. verify text to speech bubbles do not appear on first load
5. verify they can still be turned off/on okay from the toolbar

items.title: Allow/disallow student PDF toggle
items.body:
### Description
Adds PDF toggle to assignment/roster settings, enables/disables PDF download on student side accordingly. (Pro teacher only, pro and basic students)

### Tickets

[746](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-746)

### Test Cases
This must be tested against a local WS instance AND use a local db, since a migration is necessary. 
[Branch is here](https://github.com/classkick/web-services/tree/jennifer/feature/KICK-747). 
Run `gradle dbUpdate` to do the migration. (OR maybe `./gradlew dbLocalCreateContainer` and `./gradlew dbLocalStart`, I had some trouble so I did a few).

**Teacher Side**
1. login as pro teacher
2. click any assignment, visit Assign tab
3. assign a roster with at least one portfolio student on it
4. open dev tools network tab
5. toggle the PDF switch to "off"
6. [verify] a PUT was sent with the body containing `allow_pdf: false` among other things
9. visit View Work tab
10. open filters
11. toggle PDF switch again
12. check in network tab that the PUT was sent

**Student Side**
1. log in as a portfolio student for that same roster
2. click through to assignment, then click the person icon in the top left hand corner
3. if PDF is available, the PDF option should be enabled/clickable
4. download PDF make sure that works fine
5. log back into teacher, click one of the toggles to disable it
6. log back into student, check that the PDF option is now greyed out
7. Test this same behavior for a basic student on the same roster

**Lastly...** this is not connected to firebase so it doesn't live update. We have a work around to just show an error to the student if the teacher changes it while they are on the page. To test that....

1. log into teacher, toggle PDFs to "on"
2. in an incognito tab, log on as student, visit assignment in question
3. without closing either tab, toggle PDFs to "off" on teacher side
4. try to export to PDF on student side
5. [verify] you see a notification that reads "Sorry! Your teacher has disallowed downloading PDFs for this assignment."

items.title: Hackathon/text to speech/updates
items.body: ### Description Text to speech updates: 1. Speech will only stop/start, no pause resume functionality since voices on chromebook do not work with that feature of the speech synthesis library 2. Text to speech clickable icon can be turned off and on from the toolbar ### Tickets n/a; hackathon from may ### Test Cases Stop/start: 1. log in as teacher, open assignment with at least two text boxes 2. click into a single slide 3. click on any of the text to speech bubbles, then before it's done speaking, click the bubble again 4. [verify] it stops speaking 5. click the same bubble a third time 6. [verify] it starts the text box content over 7. click on any TTS bubble, then before it's done speaking, click on a _different_ TTS bubble 8. [verify] the original text box stops, the new one starts Off/On from the toolbar: 1. log in as a teacher 9. open up an assignment with a text box added as lesson content (edit page) 10. click into a single slide 11. toggle the TTS button in the toolbar (picture of the button attached at bottom) 12. [verify] text to speech bubbles appear/disappear with button click 13. visit view work, pull up an single page view of a student who has added a text box to the page 14. [verify] clicking the toolbar button shows/hides all the TTS bubbles, both from the assignment content and the student work 15. [verify] the same thing for text boxes that are **teacher feedback** or **student feedback** as well

items.title: adds some error handling for blank or undefined teacher names
items.body:
### Description
When I first checked that the WS release was working fine I saw a bunch of "undefined"s come up for teacher names -- I haven't been able to reproduce the error (??) but this adds some error handling if undefined shows back up for the teacher names

### Tickets

n/a

### Test Cases

1. run against production `npm run start:production`
2. log in as a teacher with teacher metrics data (alexandra1@cktest.com, 111)
3. visit order details page, 
4. make sure that in the top three teachers left hand bar you only see relevant teacher names or anonymous teacher
5. In order to test the error handling, one option is to hardcode some bad data into line 361 of order-detail.controller.js -- set `this._mostActiveTeachers = [{first_name: 'undefined', last_name: undefined, display_name: null}, {first_name: 'janetundefined', last_name: null, display_name: 0}];` or something like that
6. revisit order-details, verify it does not display any of the bad data

items.title: Add top 3 teachers to the order page
items.body:
### Description
Adds a segment to the order page with the top three most active teachers if any are available from the usage stats endpoint. Looks somethin' like this.
![LOGGED IN](https://github.com/classkick/classkick-web/assets/43506873/3bfae7b0-0b98-4da0-aaa5-aad8c5603de7)

### Tickets

[634](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-634)

### Test Cases

**IMPORTANT: must be tested with the WS branch here https://github.com/classkick/web-services/pull/884, which must be run against production bc of Postgres.**
1. log into an account which is connected to an org which has postgres teacher metrics data (alexandra1@cktest.com, pw: 111)
2. visit http://localhost:8080/#/order/XMHN76 (should be the right order for that account)
3. verify that you see teachers' first & last names and, if possible, their prefix (mr/ms/mx/etc)
4. log out
5. visit http://localhost:8080/#/order/XMHN76
6. verify that you see teachers' first names only, along with their prefix if possible

items.title: Feature/kick 638/add top 3 teachers to org stats
items.body:
#### Description 
Usage-stats endpoint was returning "active teachers" which actually wasn't being used for anything -- now we want to use it to fill the new top 3 teachers box which will appear on the order page. 

so, active teachers has been updated to return the top three teachers who have logged into their accounts within the last school year, sorted by how many assignments they have. 

#### Tickets

[638](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-638)

#### Test Cases

1. run gradle test, make sure that's all well & good
2. spin up cloud sql proxy and bootrun against **production**
3. pop onto postman, get a teacher login token for an account which has postgres teacher metrics data. You can use:
```{
    "id": "alexandra1@cktest.com",
    "auth": {
        "password": "111",
        "type": "password"
    }
}
```
4. save that token to postman's development env under teacher-user-token
5. grab the org id for the org that alexandra's account is connected to (`AXIB1QiHTVCUYiJ_3cmhig`) & save that to postman's development env under organization-id
6. run a GET for the [usage stats](https://classkick.postman.co/workspace/My-Workspace~dee0bee5-d425-482a-830d-a635c09de424/request/12059324-a5ee7679-10dc-4b90-9580-c95085d36610)
7. verify that active_teachers now has first_name, last_name, display_name, last login, and assignment count in there
8. remove the Authorization key from the usage-stats headers and run the GET again
9. verify that you get the info back but the teacher last names are empty strings

items.title: Fix/kick 632/renewal banner not closing
items.body:
#### Description
user reported they couldn't scroll to all their assignments while the conversion banner was present. in addition, some users were seeing the "X" button as non-responsive (couldn't get rid of the banner).

this ensures all list items are still scrollable when the banner is present and the X button shouldn't break now. 

#### Tickets
[632](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-632)

#### Test Cases

Test scrollability first:
1. Open incognito window
2. Log into an admin account with some assignments, rosters, & students (admin@haltest.com, 111)
3. Visit assignments page
4. Scroll all the way to the bottom, make sure no list items are cut off
5. Make the screen short enough that some list items go off page, then make sure you can still scroll to all list items
6. Visit manage users page
7. Do steps 3&4
8. Visit rosters page
9. Do steps 3&4
10. Click to hide all of the rosters, then visit hidden rosters page
11. Do steps 3&4

Please some of these with one or two of your own accounts as well, want to make sure the banner is still showing properly for all cases

Then test close-ability:
1. close banner
2. verify it closes
3. log out, log back into an account which is up for renewal but the org does not yet have any order created
4. close the banner
5. verify it closes

items.title: ensure shoutout metrics don't get doubled
items.body: #### Description shout out metrics would get calculated twice occasionally while the order details page was populating, now it doesn't #### Tickets [628](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-628) #### Test Cases 1. pull up incognito winder üöúüåæüßëüèº‚Äçüåæ (if it's not incognito sometimes it only loads/calculates once) 2. log in to any account 3. visit order details page 4. ensure the cumulative shout out score is the correct total compared to the individual counts in the tooltip

items.title: generate order if free trial user does not have one
items.body:
### Description
Previously if a user was on an org with a free trial contract but their org didn't have an order generated it would error out the tada overlay. 
I looked and there were 663 orgs for which this was the case, so I figured it was worth fixing. Now if they login and are supposed to be shown the overlay, it'll generate the order if there isn't one

### Tickets

[620](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-620)

### Test Cases

1. log into a free trial account which does not have an order generated for it (protrial@cktest.com, 111)
2. it should load a second then show you the overlay
3. check in sql to make sure the org has an order now `select * from classkick.`order` o where o.organization_id = 'AYZ7SYDKQkySTBnc4d5Ivg';`


if you didn't see the overlay at first enter this into the console `localStorage.last_seen_pro_trial_conversion_overlay = '"2023-04-02T20:42:30.516Z"'` and refresh the page. 
After that, check to make sure the `getOrCreateRenewalOrder` function still works for its other purposes -->
1. log into an account which has an expiring contract (expiringcontract@gmail.com, e)
2. click on the subscription link in the lefthand nav bar menu
3. make sure it takes you to the order page and nothing is weird

items.title: adds tracking from orderPage & removes duplicate locations
items.body:
#### Description
Will now track when a user (logged out or anon) sends a referral email from the order page
This PR also removes the QUOTE_PAGE location 

#### Tickets

[569](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-569)
[570](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-570)

#### Test Cases

1. Visit http://localhost:8080/#/order
2. Pop open the console's network tab
3. Click FORWARD THIS INFO
4. Pick an existing school (Beany's Free Trial Org)
5. Send the email to whoever
6. [verify] you see a POST request to /order/{orderId}/track with a payload similar to `order_trackings: [{tracking_id: "admin_email_sent", target: "heyhal19@gmail.com", source: "orderPage", user_id: null}]`
7. Visit an existing order https://staging.classkick.com/#/order/KA5PA7
8. [verify] you see a POST request similar to `order_trackings: [{tracking_id: "quote_page_view", target: null, source: "orderDetails", user_id: null}]`
9. Click EMAIL TO MY ADMIN, send the email
10. [verify] the POST request has the `source` as `orderDetails` this time
11. Log in
12. Complete steps 1-5
13. [verify] the POST is like `order_trackings: [{tracking_id: "admin_email_sent", target: "heyhal19@gmail.com", source: "orderPage", user_id: someUserId}]`

items.title: Feature/add tracking for quote page users
items.body:
#### Description
Allow us to track the following actions in-house:
1. When anyone views a quote, logged in or no
2. When anyone sends their admin an email from the order-detail (quote) page

#### Tickets

[511](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-511)

#### Test Cases

1. Open network tab in dev console, filter by "track"
2. Visit order detail page for any order while logged out (http://localhost:8080/#/order/AJT88S)
3. [verify] the POST request was sent with the payload `order_trackings: [{tracking_id: "quote_page_view", target: null, source: "quote_page", user_id: null}]`
4. Log in and visit the order-detail (quote) page for any account
5. Check network tab, [verify] the track POST request was sent again, but this time with the correct user ID
6. Click "Email To My Admin" in the top right
7. Fill in a single email in the To field, click SEND EMAIL REMINDER
8. [verify] the POST request is sent with the correct user ID and the admin recipient's email listed in the `target` section
9. Open up the Email To My Admin dialog again, this time fill out several emails in the To field, separated by commas
10. #sendit
11. [verify] the POST request is sent and each recipient email that you entered receives its own object in the order_trackings array
12. Check in sql that each email gets its own order_tracking entry with `select * from classkick.order_tracking ot where ot.order_id ='order id here';`

items.title: Text to Speech (Hackathon)
items.body:
#### Description
Adds a bubble students, helpers, and teachers can click next to every text box on the canvas. Clicking starts text to speech. 

#### Tickets
n/a hackathon

#### Test Cases
1. Log in as a teacher, add some text boxes to the canvas, assign a roster
2. Log into that assignment as a student, add some text boxes
3. Click any of the TTS buttons. [verify] it plays the right text
4. Click on any TTS button, then
5. Click on it again before the speech is finished
6. [verify] the speech stops
7. Click on it again, [verify] the speech resumes (unpause functionality)
8. Click on any TTS button, then
9. Click on any DIFFERENT TTS button
10. [verify] the original speech stops, and the new one begins. No pause state is retained.
11. Now test the same functionality again (4-10) in the following scenarios:

1. When you are the teacher on a student SQV
2. When you are a teacher in assignment edit
3. When you are a peer helper on another student's SQV
4. When you are a student clicking on a peer helper's TTS box



UPDATE:
Please check in whatever browsers you've got installed. Safari, Chrome, Firefox, Brave, Opera...you don't have to check all of them since this will have a bigger testing party on staging, but spot check a few

items.title: Feature/kick 471/add custom email functionality to select peers dialog
items.body:
#### Description
Adds tests & analytics to the "add custom peer email" functionality (merged from this [PR](https://github.com/classkick/classkick-web/pull/1701)). 

Want to merge all of it into develop. The only new changes can be see in the [add tests commit](https://github.com/classkick/classkick-web/commit/73ff604839da9bfcecb957bd548b78806a14f8ec) and the [analytics commit](https://github.com/classkick/classkick-web/commit/60d5a4a08484057f9c4ae80aa568395e05b70d15).

(Apologies, I should have pulled out a different branch to add these last two things by themselves, but didn't realize it until the end.)

As for the analytics naming choice itself, let me know if what I went with makes sense. These should fire from the select peers dialog regardless of where the user clicked through from, so I thought that should be the "place". 

#### Tickets

[496](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-496)

#### Test Cases
Tests:
1. review tests, run them, make sure they pass

Analytics:
1. login with somebody who's got a free trial & MDR data (trials@haltest.com, 111)
2. click SELECT COLLEAGUES
3. add a custom email (should auto check it)
4. check an MDR email as well
5. send it üöÄ 
6. see that the mixpanel events `selectPeersPeersDialog:custom_email_referred` and `selectPeersPeersDialog:mdr_email_referred` came through

items.title: add custom email functionality & new icons to select peers dialog
items.body: #### Description Same as title ^^ #### Tickets [475](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-475) [474](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-474) [473](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-473) [472](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-472) Design [here](https://www.figma.com/file/IIBoLSHrXFJIa6rqGngu8S/trials_onboarding?node-id=3001-23482) (design is missing error state and the email icon looks different [jer supplied me with a new svg]) #### Test Cases 1. Log into a free trial account with an MDR PID (trials@haltest.com, 111) 2. Click GIFT PRO FOR FREE from nav 3. Click SELECT COLLEAGUES 4. Type some non-MDR email in the box 5. [verify] when it hits "0 RESULTS", the new instruction bar pops up 6. Hit enter 7. [verify] the email address you typed is added to the list and automatically checked 8. Hit enter again...and again and again! 9. [verify] the email cannot be added more than once 10. Clear out your search, type in something that isn't a valid email 11. Hit enter 12. [verify] an error state pops up which says "Input must be a valid email address" 13. Start typing again 14. [verify] the error state goes away

items.title: Fast follow for select peers dialog uupdates
items.body:
### Description
With these updates all accounts which are either pro or on a free trial & whose main school has an MDR PID will be shown the share order dialog with the "SELECT COLLEAGUES" button. If they‚Äôre pro/free trial but the school doesn‚Äôt have an MDR PID, they will be shown the "TO" field with the "SEND" button instead. This applies to the buttons shown in the overlay, nav bar, assignment edit, assignment roster, and view work pages.

This also adds in an error state if the MDR PID returns an empty array of colleagues. 

There's also some noise from the autoformatter cleaning up spacing, jfyi.

### Tickets

[456](https://getclasskick.atlassian.net/browse/KICK-456)

### Test Cases

**Free Trial Account w/MDR PID**
1. Log into [trials@haltest.com](mailto:trials@haltest.com), pw 111
2. Click the "GIFT PRO FOR FREE" buttons from all five locations (to get the overlay to show, bring up dev tools and enter `localStorage.pro_trial_overlay_seen = 'false'` in the console)
3. [verify] all dialogs show you the "SELECT COLLEAGUES" button (no "TO" field)

**Free Trial Account w/o MDR PID**
1. Log into freeteacher@haltest.com, pw 111
2. Click the "GIFT PRO FOR FREE" buttons from all five locations (to get the overlay to show, bring up dev tools and enter `localStorage.pro_trial_overlay_seen = 'false'` in the console)
3. [verify] all dialogs show the "TO" field with a "SEND" button

**Pro Account w/o MDR PID**
1. Log into [ateacher@haltest.com](mailto:ateacher@haltest.com), pw 111
4. Click the "SHARE WITH A COLLEAGUE" buttons from all four locations (won‚Äôt have an overlay, it‚Äôs a pro school)
5. [verify] all dialogs show the "TO" field with a "SEND" button

**Pro Account w/MDR PID**
1. Log into [proPID@haltest.com](mailto:proPID@haltest.com), pw 111
2. Click the "SHARE WITH A COLLEAGUE" buttons from all four locations (won‚Äôt have an overlay, it‚Äôs a pro school)
3. [verify] all dialogs show you the "SELECT COLLEAGUES" button (no "TO" field)

**Account where MDR PID exists, but no colleagues are return**
1. Log into sporks@haltest.com, pw, 111
2. Open referral dialog
3. Click "SELECT COLLEAGUES" button
4. [verify] you see the "An error occurred. Please check that your account has been verified by your school's admin." error

I know that's not super wonderful, but it's temporary. In a future iteration the select peers dialog will allow you to add emails manually, so that will be the eventual real solution for this.

items.title: to input for referral dialog should not show if mdr pid is preesent
items.body: #### Description Fixes an error in the latest release branch -- the "TO" field and the "SELECT PEERS" button should never show at the same time. Prevents that #### Tickets n/a #### Test Cases Previously: Should now be:
